Articles.Content:
Hi, im a new add-on maker started learning today, in fact. I was looking through the Requests section when I found a post looking for the SpaceX Rockets and capsule. Just curoius who would be interested. If i go ahead i promise i won\'t adfly anyone ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

1st Part ready for release

Check Addon Relases and Showcase Soon !

There was at least one Falcon-9-inspired pack released after that thread: [http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=4604.0](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=4604.0)

Don\'t let that stop you though; if you feel like you can create a good pack based on SpaceX rockets, by all means do so, I would love to see it; it doesn\'t matter if someone else has done it.

oh.... btw AMAZING someone actually cared enough to comment on a noob ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) but question, how do i put pics in the main post (i have NEVER used a forum before)

Well first you will want to upload them to an image hosting site like http://imgur.com; each one will have a 'Direct Link' URL that you can copy.

Then when making your post, click the IMG button above the text box (first button on the 2nd row, before the URL and EMAIL button;

That creates a set of IMG tags in brackets, which you place your Direct Link URL in from your image host.

    [img=http://img98.imageshack.us/img98/3893/tiberdynesig2.png]

![tiberdynesig2.png](http://img98.imageshack.us/img98/3893/tiberdynesig2.png)

When you post it, your image will load. If you post a big image or several images in one post, you also need to put SPOILER tags around them to hide them until the button is pushed:

[spoiler][img=http://img98.imageshack.us/img98/3893/tiberdynesig2.png][/spoiler]

Looks like this: 

> ![tiberdynesig2.png](http://img98.imageshack.us/img98/3893/tiberdynesig2.png)

The other method is attaching the image directly to your post, but doing it that way is discouraged in most cases; To do it, you click on 'Attachments and other options' and use the browse button to select your image; it will be attached to your post as a thumbnail after you click post. Again, though; attach images as a last resort, please.

thank you, Tiberion ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) btw, any idea who to ask for help on animated solar panels?

EDIT: am i allowed to put spacex logos and such on the models??

EDIT 2: also should i use media fire or is there a better dl hosting site available??

Check out this plugin for animations, including solar panels: [http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=9017.0](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=9017.0)

I am not a trademark lawyer, so I can\'t 100% tell you that its okay, but as long as you aren\'t making money on the project it is probably okay to use their logo on a fan-made model.

Mediafire works fine for hosting downloads; most people here use it or Dropbox. Its not good for hosting images though, if that is what you were referring to.
TYVM, Tiberion and yeah, i was asking about when i actually finish a piece
Ive got a input string not in correct format error, any idea whats wrong??

I need the exact error; you can also find the errors in the output\_log.txt file, which is inside of the KSP\_Data folder; attach that to your post after starting KSP, getting the error and exiting immediately.

Ah, I see.

This post should help you find the Log files on Mac OS: [http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=10553.msg161397#msg161397](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=10553.msg161397#msg161397)
well i found it NOW its in the spoiler
can you attach the part.cfg for that fuel tank to your post?

here it is

> 
> // Kerbal Space Program - Part CFG file // Falcon 1 2nd stage tank
> 
> // --- General Parameters ---
> 
> name = Falcon stage 2 tank
> 
> module = fuelTank
> 
> author = YourName
> 
> // --- Asset Parameters ---
> 
> mesh = myMesh.dae
> 
> scale = 0.1
> 
> texture = Falcon 1 fueltank 2.png
> 
> specPower = 0.5
> 
> rimFalloff = 3
> 
> alphaCutoff = 0
> 
> // --- Node Definitions ---
> 
> node\_stack\_bottom = 0.0, -3.5, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1.0
> 
> // --- FX Definitions ---
> 
> // ---Editor parameters ---
> 
> cost = 120
> 
> category = 0
> 
> subcategory = 0
> 
> title = Stage 2 Fueltank
> 
> manufacturer = SuperSonic Inc.
> 
> description = Stage 2 Fueltank of the Falcon 1
> 
> // --- Standard part parameters ---
> 
> mass = 1.5
> 
> dragModelType = default
> 
> maximum\_drag = 0.4
> 
> minimum\_drag = 0.2
> 
> angularDrag = 0.2
> 
> crashTolerance = 5
> 
> maxTemp = 2500
> 
> // --- Special Part Parameters ---
> 
> fuel = 800
> 
> dryMass = 0.2
> 
> fullExplosionPotential = 15
> 
> emptyExplosionPotential = 5

Capitalize the F in the module = FuelTank line; that tells KSP what type of part is it and much match the part type exactly.

Another thing; You should remove the spaces in your name = line as asll we the file names for your DAE and TXT files; its not absolutely necessary, but it will make things easier down the road.

do something like sonic\_Fueltank for the name= and make the filenames; sonic\_falcontank.dae

You can pick your own prefix or whatever to make them unique, of course.
TYTYTYTY TIBERION I GIVE YOU CREDIT FOR MAKING THIS WORK (sorry for all caps)
how do i move this thread later??

I just merged your two topics together, you can keep any help requests in here, as well as updates or whatever; and when you\'re ready to release it you can just make a new topic in the projects forum and we\'ll lock this.
thanks Tiberion
its doing the same error, unfortunately >![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
Well, if you can pack up the part folder into a zip and share it so I can look at it, I\'ll troubleshoot it when I have a chance.
If you could, that would be AMAZING how do i give it to you, do you have an email i can use??
Under my name and picture to the left are three buttons; Click the Personal Message icon and you can send me the URL of your uploaded file via a private message on the forum.
my file is too large to fit on media fire for free ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Haven\'t figured it out yet, gonna need some help from other people...

I am almost certain the issue is with your cfg file and what program you edited it in; when I load it up in Notepad it doesn\'t read any of the Newline characters, though it loads fine in Textpad.

Whatever happened to the file seems to be breaking the KSP config parser as well; I am attaching both the original cfg (part.cfg) file and one I edited in notepad (part\_new.cfg) to add new Newline chars (it didn\'t help, and when I load it in Textpad now, everything is doublespaced..)

I am short on time this evening, so hopefully someone else can figure it out sooner.

Oh and of course here is the error it is outputting when loading in KSP:

    >> Falconstage2tank >>(Filename: C:/BuildAgent/work/b0bcff80449a48aa/Runtime/ExportGenerated/StandalonePlayer/UnityEngineDebug.cpp Line: 43)loading binary model from (System.String s) [0x00000] in :0  at PartLoader.ParsePartCfg () [0x00000] in :0  at PartLoader.doProcessPart (UnityEngine.GameObject[] mdls, Boolean partLabMode) [0x00000] in :0  at PartLoader.startPartAssembly (UnityEngine.GameObject[] mdls) [0x00000] in :0  at PartSerializer+c__IteratorA.MoveNext () [0x00000] in :0 (Filename: Line: -1)

I checked the DAE and even re-exported it, its simple and I am 99% certain its not a DAE issue.

(also attached the part folder for testing, we\'ll delete it after we\'re done)
